titleInfo.title: SOUTH CAROLINA PEANUT PARITY ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: SOUTH CAROLINA PEANUT PARITY ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 176

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: South Carolina Peanut Parity Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 2521, to amend the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to include South Carolina as a part of the Virginia/Carolina peanut producing region for purposes of appointment to the Peanut Standards Board, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 394 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 591.

congVote.result: The PRESIDING OFFICER. Under the previous order, the motion to reconsider is considered made and laid upon the table and the President will be immediately be notified of the Senate's action.

extension.searchTitle: CLOTURE MOTION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 176

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate received the following message from the President of the United States:<P/>Transmitting, pursuant to law, a report relative to the continuation of the national emergency relative to the actions and policies of the Government of Sudan as declared in Executive Order 13067 of November 3, 1997; which was referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. (PM-18)<P/>Senate resumed consideration of the nomination of Joan Louise Larsen, of Michigan, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Sixth Circuit.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 60 yeas to 38 nays (Vote No. 256), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
